sections.heading: occurring during preceding term
sections.text: An impeachment against any state officer shall be tried and judgment of removal from office, or disqualification to hold office, may be rendered, notwithstanding the offense for which said officer is tried occurred during a term of office immediately preceding.SourceL

24-109.Offenses occurring during preceding term.

An impeachment against any state officer shall be tried and judgment of removal from office, or disqualification to hold office, may be rendered, notwithstanding the offense for which said officer is tried occurred during a term of office immediately preceding.

SourceLaws 1879, § 9, p. 83;R.S.1913, § 1136;C.S.1922, § 1065;C.S.1929, § 27-109;R.S.1943, § 24-109.

Annotations

Nebraska's impeachment statutes specifically provide that a state officer may be impeached notwithstanding the offense for which said officer is tried occurred during a term of office immediately preceding. Nebraska Legislature on behalf of State v. Hergert, 271 Neb. 976, 720 N.W.2d 372 (2006).
